0: Digestive system diseases: these conditions span a wide spectrum of disorders that affect the gastrointestinal (GI) tract, liver, gallbladder, and pancreas, as well as obesity and other nutrition-related disorders.
1: Cardiovascular diseases: a type of disease that affects the heart or blood vessels.
2: Neoplasms: an abnormal mass of tissue that forms when cells grow and divide more than they should or do not die when they should. Also called tumor.
3: Nervous system disease: any of the diseases or disorders that affect the functioning of the human nervous system.
4: General pathological conditions: abnormal anatomical or physiological conditions and objective or subjective manifestations of disease, not classified as disease or syndrome.
